This is one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. Not only is the atmosphere cozy and homey but the staff is lovely. This is the go to place to celebrate my mom's birthday every year! If your so inclined their drinks are great. The chicken fajita burrito is my personal favorite. Lovely place for the family and easy on your budget too!

I have passed this location many times growing up in this city and never thought anything of the place behind Circle K, put once again I can thank Yelp for inspiration after reading a few reviews.  I love that these guys are open at 10 am since that is lunch time for me because I start my morning at 5am.  The salsa was fantastic (always a good sign) and the bean dip was alright but not my favorite.  I love that they have a huge menu of $6 lunch specials.  My waitress told me that the number 7 (2 chicken enchiladas) was the most popular.  I had it with the sour cream and it was absolutely delicious.  The beans and rice were great also, I seen the Wednesday and Thursday specials that everyone was talking about and will have to check those out sometime soon.  The service was good for me but I was the first one there at 10am, I read a few of the negative reviews mentioning that but I enjoyed the experience.  I also thought the atmosphere was really clean and nice, actually was kind of surprised since reviews I read mentioned otherwise.  I don't know what people expect but I was overly impressed with the whole experience.  There was even a flat screen TV and the posters on the wall weren't to much.  I will be back soon.

Ive been coming here for years and they deserve 5 stars because they have tasty and consistent mexican food. The food is a cut above your standard mexican fare. I recomend the any of the lunch specials but I especially like the chicken enchiladas with green tamatillo sauce, comes with rice and beans. 8.50$ Also everyone that works their is very friendly.
Very good food and prices. My husband is hard to please and he topped this restaurant as his #2 favorite.
Great place for authentic Mexican food! They're like family here. (My son's one of their best customers. The food is super!)

Las Gloria's is a favorite neighborhood spot. Good, home style Mexican food with a very friendly staff and fair prices. We eat there once or twice a month and they always remember us. Their fajitas are a favorite - the Suprema (chicken, beef, shrimp) is big enough for two. Ask for extra tortillas if you're going to share.   They also have some of the best chips and salsa in town, and they are served with an awesome bean dip.

First time here today.  I liked it. We had the enchildas suizas and the chimis. Both were delicious. I also had a strawberry margarita that was great too. The entrance is messed up due to construction but thats okay. I will be back.

Deliciousness - 3.5/5 Happiness - 2/5  There is nothing wrong with the place, it just doesn't stand out. It isn't so high end that it constitutes a hidden gem, and despite having low prices,  I feel you can get better quality of food for a comparable price.   The  complimentary chips with salsa and bean dip were incredible. And the margaritas were a great buy ($4-8 for a huge drink) But all the entrees were simply ok. They lacked any appreciable spice or flavor. The dishes weren't bad, just bland. That said, they absolutely give you massive quantities - it is easily the best kids menu deal I've seen (six slices of cheese enchilada, a generous portion of rice and beans, a drink, and a dessert of ice cream and churros).  But what really gets the low rating is the service. The waiters were friendly, but it took forever. The dinner lasted two hours and that was simply because we were not checked on with any consistency. It took us over half an hour to get anyone to come take our order. And several requests to re-fill water before it happened. The cook time was very long too. I wanted to order a to-go entrée for my wife at home, but ultimately skipped it due to the incredible wait time.

Don't let her looks fool you Las Glorias is awesome! Sure she is located in a run-down strip mall but the food is delicious!  Piping hot chips are served with salsa and a yummy bean dip. Big, cheap margaritas and great specials on combo plates. I got the 2 burrito plate and had one left over for lunch the next day. The carne asada and pork are both excellent.  I have to remember Wednesday's - DOLLAR Tacos!!!!  The servers are friendly and the décor is tacky. This is a great Mexican place.

This place has some really excellent authentic Mexican food.  Ordered the green chile pork burrito.  Everything about it was good especially the salsa.  The guacamole was perfect and the churros for desert was a great way to end the meal. The service was very friendly and fast.  Definitely coming back next time I am in Arizona.

Friendly atmosphere, food is always consistent. Great chips and salsa, bean dip too. We always ask for hot salsa My favorite is the beef fajitas, my wife usually orders shrimp ceviche tostada with a side of mayo. I also like the arroz con pollo. Service is always good.
This is our family's go to Mexican restaurant. Great service, great value, great food and AMPLE PORTIONS!
We stumbled upon this place because we had the entertainment book. Glad we did. Great food!

First time I've been here and it was amazing. The chips and salsa are great, as well as the bean dip. I'm from cincinnati, so it was my first time here and what really won me over was the 1.99 margaritas all day everyday! They are delicious!
Food was really good service ok got ignored once but the dessert n food was bomb might come back again .

Pretty good Mexican food.  Great cheap Margs (just like Chi Chi's used to make!) and really great bean dip to go with the chips.  Yum.  Love the Sour Cream Chicken enchilada/Taco Combo.  The fajitas look very good as well.    Service is usually okay but it depends on the night.  The strip mall location is not perfect....but go on in and enjoy!

Went there because of the 4 star review. The service was average but it seemed if you where a regular you got a lot better service. I had the lunch #12 a burro with chilie filling. This is where my opinion goes way down. The flavor was good but the meat was really tough and full of gristle. I could not eat about a 1/4 of it. I mentioned this to my server and she just nodded and went on about her business. No I sorry or anything. This is why I am writing this poor review. Even if you been in business for a long time you will not get new customers this way. I will go by to my standby places not here again.

Update your hours of operation on Sunday listed in the yelp profile!! It's says open until 10pm and I came down here thinking your business was open when you were not! Very misleading and unprofessional. Not only that but when I told the Girl that was sweeping just so she knew, she was very rude and tried to ignore me. I've came in this place plenty of time and gave them plenty of business and I am a very satisfying tipper. Terrible experience please remove the "homegirl" from front of house. You might not get returning customers due to that attitude!

Excellent food.  Excellent service.  They allow reservations as well.    We had a party of 20 on mothers day and were able to reserve a table before hand.   High stars for fish fajitas, tamales and seafood soup.

Absolutely our family favorite local spot! Food is great and we always receive prompt service. Don't let the outside deter you away, as the the inside is nice and welcoming. Definitely recommend trying this place out!

Ok, here's the deal: I read the mostly glowing reviews and got a buy one get one free that I can use for lunch. That's a deal! BUT-------------- When I ordered, it seemed like a high ending price with tax for a $7 lunch special. The waitress' answer? I had to pay tax not only for the $7 lunch plate but also the entree I got free! So I paid nearly double the tax (ripoff) especially the tax for something I didn't order. How does that figure? The food-got stomachache later on. The seafood tasted like plastic, like it came from a plastic bag or, worse, been in the freezer for a while. Only the beans had flavor.  Save your money and go to Taco Bell.
I like the bean dip. The salsa was decent.  I had the Chile Colorado burrito, chimichanga style.  Delicious.  I went with friends. It's not really my neighborhood, but if invited, I would return.

Why did I not eat here ever before in my 28 years?    I have always lived around this area and seen Las Glorias Grill in the small strip mall behind the Circle K at 19th and Northern.  My husband and I decided to finally try here tonight when we wanted mexican food.  It was DELICIOUS!  We usually go to places like Garcia's, Manuel's, and Macayo's but I think that will be ending now that we have eaten here.  The chips, salsa, and bean dip were brought out to us very quickly along with our drinks.  The chips were very fresh with just the right amount of salt on them.  The food was brought out pretty quickly thereafter.  I ordered the shrimp enchilada and my husband order a beef chimichanga.  The chimichanga looked like it  was lightly fried - just to the right level of fried.  The shrimp enchilada was probably the largest enchilada I have ever seen.  The shrimp were large and the amount of them in the enchilada was very generous.  The flour tortilla used for the enchilada was very light and tasty.  Both entrees came with rice and beans.  I would say that the rice was right on par with what is made in other restaurants but I believe that the refried beans are better here.    The service was prompt and very attentive (unlike previous experiences at other restaurants).  I would definitely recommend coming here instead of going to any of the more familiar chains out there!

While we have been here a number of times,  this is my first review.   This place is phenomenal!   This is probably the best Mexican food we have had for a very long time!     The service is always top and always fast.   It is my understanding the restaurant is owned and operated  by Hispanics.  They have a good Hispanic clientele  ...but there are plenty of us Gringos as well.  If you like Mexican food,  this is not to be missed!
Amazing Mexican food and great servers! Love this place and would recommend it to anyone I know :)

Just really good Mexican food.  My go to is the ceviche tostada and two rolled tacos.  The Cesar salad w pepita lime dressing is also good.  The menu also includes $1.99 house margaritas and whole grilled fish and ostiones.

First, it is a little difficult to get to, due to the light-rail construction, but once you do, it is worth it!!  We first used to go there, quite awhile ago, when the owner would come out, and wait on us.   We've come back, even after moving out of the neighborhood, a few years ago.  They offer up 99 cent margaritas, all day, every day.  Their chips and salsa are so good.  The chips are thin, and probably baked, which means that I eat twice as many!  *wink*  They bring out a bean dip (warm), and a salsa, both of them are very good.  My husband orders Chicken Enchilada dinner (it comes out *sizzling* hot), and I order Shrimp Ranchero Burro.  The shrimps are yummy, nice and plump, and the dnners are presented very attractively.  We used to download a coupon BOGO (buy one-get one free), and order up a few of those 99 cent margaritas.  They still offer up the coupon, but there is no more 99 cent margaritas included.  So today I had a bottled beer, my husband had an iced tea.  The total was under $19.00 -- not bad!  We try to get to Las Glorias about once a month.

I stopped in for lunch and to do some homework the other day. The staff was so friendly! The place was not very busy, as it was 2pm on a weekday, so the food came out fast. I got the fish tacos and they were very good! The rice and beans were also yummy. To drink, I got a $3 house margarita- can't beat that! Overall, a very nice experience I will definitely be going back.
Love, love, love! I have been going to Las Glorias for years and years. Consistently good and I love the staff.   Everything is amazing. Well worth your time.

Easily one of the Best Mexican Restaurant in the Greater Phoenix Area, especially for the money.  SERVICE Always friendly, fast, and very accomodating. There is not host/hostess in this restaurant. So, servers will seat you although you can seat yourself if you don't mind waiting for your server.  I have been there many times and unless they're quite busy i never wait for a refill on beverages or chips and salsa. They are not always the most thoughtful servers, but always very accomodating to your requests.   FOOD Always hot, fresh, and higher quality than most mom & pop mexican hole-in-the-walls. i have yet to find something i didn't like on the menu. However, i do reccommend any item with steak -- their steak is so favorful. Absolutely excellent!  They do offer several kinds of salsas. They usually bring out a bean salsa and your typical mexican tomato salsa. Both are good, although most of my friends and I find the bean salsa to be superior and more unique than most restaurants in this category. Also, they do make a darn good Horchatta as well.  The value of food for your money is superb! Most items do not cost more than $10. The amount of food you receive is above average, not ridiculously large, but on the more generous side. Plus, as i remember i've never been nickel and dimed for extra sides of sour cream, pico de Gallo, etc. except for maybe cheese and guacamole which is understandable (even then, i didn't pay any crazy extra amount).  AMBIANCE For being a hole-in-the-wall in a small shopping center in not the greatest of areas in Phoenix the decor is simple, mexican, and welcoming. Their restaurant is always clean from what i've seen. Bathrooms are nothing special by any means, but pretty well kept.

Amazing!!!! I ate the pork green chili, I am very picky with my green chili. It was so good the pork just melted in my mouth. The rice OMG another food I'm picky with, it's second to my rice and that's saying a lot. Went back on payday to try the pozolé, another home run! This weekend it's time to try the menudo !!

I live in the area and this is definately my go to mexican restaurant. Im a big fan of their nachos. Not just any nachos, I have them add red and green chili on top. I love their chips and salsa, along with the bean dip of course. Great tasting mexican food and courteous waitresees.

I order take out from here for lunch occasionally and I'm never disappointed: the food is always good. Plus, you get free chips, salsa, and bean dip with every order! They had quick service when I have eaten in the restaurant as well, so this is a great lunch spot during the work week!

This place has amazing food and the prices are great. Service was excellent! The guacamole is so good and a must to try. The bean dip and the salsa are also great. I was really wanting this type of Mexican food and it hit the spot. I will totally come back to this place. I had the chicken fajita burrito which used chicken breast, my husband got the taco salad in those big yummy salad bowl shells and my little girls got pizza, fries and ice cream and churros (theirs was only $6 each!!!). So good.

Love that this place has $1 margaritas all day everyday.  The food is also really good here, as the enchiladas are amazing.  The bean dip is really good and it's cool that they give it to you for free.  The place is located in kinda of a dump, however the restaurant is actually nice.

Appearances can be deceiving! Looks like a store front in a run down plaza, but don't let that keep you from entering. The atmosphere was quaint. From the chips and salsa to the fried ice cream = Fantastic. The server was noticeably busy, but another server stepped in to help out. Both were friendly, and we wanted for nothing. I'm glad we found this place. I really wanted Mexican food, and this place delivered. If I'm ever in Phoenix again I will be sure to visit.
Delicious Arroz con shrimp,  ceviche tostada, chicken enchiladas!!! Great service.  Will definitely be back

I really can't believe I haven't written a review yet for my favorite neighborhood place, Las Glorias. I love this little gem so much: wonderful, homemade food and the warmest and friendliest staff.  My favorites? The bean dip that comes with the salsa is fantastic ... not too spicy but creamy and flavorful. Whenever I feel a cold coming on, I order a large bowl of their chicken tortilla soup. It's so substantial with a good mix of chicken chunks, fresh vegetables, avocado and a savory broth. Does it cure my cold? Nope, but it really does make me feel better! Their fish tacos are my favorite in the Valley and come with whole beans that I could eat an entire potful of. If it's Friday night and my SO and I don't feel like waiting 40 minutes for one of the trendy CenPho dinner spots, we hang out at Las Glorias and get one of their tasty margaritas and their chicken avocado salad with cilantro dressing and pepitas. The man loves that they always have a sports game on TV. I love the super comfy booths and welcoming decor. They also serve a delicious garlic fish (and a few other great seafood dishes) so you don't have to sacrifice healthy eating for a night out. Don't be put off by the strip mall. They'll get to updating it eventually but for now, it houses this lovely little place so I'll take it.

So very happy finding a Mexican Restaurant that had perfect Margaritas as well as fantastic food, fantastic waitresses. I will definitely be returning to eat here again. I will also be returning with visiting Guest from out of Town.

Very good! I'm always in pursuit of a great menudo. This one is very very good and comes with all the fixings. My wife loves the chicken chimichanga. Rice and beans are authentic and Victoria (our sever) was outstanding! We will be back......

Las Glorias is still the best Mexican meal I've had in Phoenix. The construction is a distant memory and there's a gleaming new light rail stop, right across the street (that seemingly no one uses, hah). But maybe they should, because the complementary chips with salsa and beans intro is always popular. Their tortilla soup is banging. Spinach enchiladas, still amazing. Our party enjoyed an open faced cheese crisp, made from a tortilla as big as the sky above. PRO TIP: put salsa on the cheese crisp. It's certainly not the fanciest place, at the end of the meal, the way to pay is at a register. And the menu can be too big. But if you order carefully, it's legit.

Ok so I was blown away w all their food tonight. Came here for a work retirement party and I heard this place is really good for authentic Mexican food but I didn't think it was this good.  I got the sangria and my husband got a beerarita. Both very good!   First of all the chips salsa n bean dip they give you is amazing!! I finished the entire basket of chips w the bean dip!! N I hardly ever eat or enjoy beans.   As my main I got the arroz con camarones (shrimp instead of chicken) and my husband got the fajitas supremas which came with shrimp, steak and chicken w side of rice and flour tortillas. I even got one carne asada taco to try cuz I love my tacos!! Ok this is where I gave them 5 stars! Everything was delicious!! N the price point!! Can't complain!!  I will definitely b back to try other items!! And this is my new favorite Mexican restaurant!!

I ordered the huevos rancheros. It was good and tasty. They serve chips salsa w/ Beans while you wait. They also had piña water with free refills(who does that). Staff was attentive and overall the atmosphere was great for the breakfast I enjoyed.

Like the reviews say, you would probably never find it on your own and it won't stand out when you do, but the food was ok. The service was great. The girls were very helpful and friendly. I think only one behind the register spoke English well though. It was very basic. Nothing unusual or different but for what it is, pretty good. Seating restaurant style inside. My friend says it the best Mexican food anywhere. I can't tell the difference between here and Filiberto's, but hey. I'm just a dumb half Mexican white girl so what do I know.

My boyfriend took me here on our fourth date- after really talking it up.   The food is good- not gourmet Mexican, but typical Mexican. It's good. My boyfriend loves the free bean dip. So much so that I bought some for his Mexican themed 30th birthday party.  Cheap drinks, although I am sure the ingredients are not quality.  Super nice wait staff. Don't let the location fool you, definitely check this place out.

I really love this place the owner is outstanding , but...on a recent order and this is the second time now that my friends brought me back my favorite salad and i was not happy , they do tend to stinge on the chicken , for a big salad the chicken was barely there , just some dried out corners that probably was half of a breast chopped in tiny pieces , I will go back to eat there no doubt but I do have to address the issue because I do not have the time to run back during my lunch time , please make sure your order to go looks decent , thanks

4.5 stars indeed!   Had the Spinach enchilada and Chicken/avocado salad! It was super flavorful and delicious.   They catered to a diet request which is important!  However, It wasn't packed due to the time we ate but service wasn't quite as fast as expected!

Exactly what you call HIDDEN GEM! Food is literally amazing- they give you amazing salsa, bean dip and chips. Get the guacamole- it was fresh, a good serving, and had a kick. 3$ margaritas! Really need to check it out for amaZing Mexican food and drinks! It was so good we forgot to take pics!

Gloria's is where we go every Thursday for $1.50 tacos and 99 cent margaritas.   It is just down the street; in our neighborhood and where we always go.  We love the place.  The service is good and they are very professional and courteous - not to mention lovely.  To be honest I used to go there in the 70's when it was El Tango (and not as good!).  Now they are on the trail of the light rail and we hope the parking doesn't make things difficult for them but allows them to become one of those institutions along 19th Avenue.
The menudo here is goooood. They have great seviche and drinks. Everything on their menu is great. It's a hole in the wall but very clean.  You will feel welcomed here.
I had the shrimp enchiladas, and they were awesome. My friend had a burrito and a cheese quesadilla and lived them. Very authentic.
